newsitem.title: NORWAY: Norway says hijacked Bulgarian plane en route.
newsitem.headline: Norway says hijacked Bulgarian plane en route.

text.p: A hijacked Bulgarian airliner has taken off from Varna airport for Oslo, the Norwegian news agency NTB said on Tuesday.
It quoted a Norwegian aviation official as saying the TU-154 plane was expected in Oslo at 8 p.m. (1800gmt).
"The hijacked Bulgarian plane has taken off from Varna airport and is headed for Oslo," NTB quoted aviation authority spokesman Finn Langeland as saying.
The plane was expected to land at Oslo's Gardermoen airport, where police were put on alert, NTB said.
"We don't know why the hijacker wants to fly to Norway," a justice ministry official said.

The plane, taken over by a lone hijacker on a flight from Beirut, was hijacked shortly before landing at Varna airport. A Varna airport official said the hijacker had released all 150 passengers on arrival at Varna but had kept crew members aboard.
